reviews.review_msg: Took this course with the accounting Richard. Hated the material but Richard made it as good as it gets. Funny jokes and i can tell he genuinely cares. Great guy - I can see why he's a hit at UBC.

Very fair exams, no surprises. As long as you do all the practice questions he gives you, and the assignments, you will do well! Also very clear during lecture. I would definitely recommend taking a course with him if you can!!
Very fair exams. Assignments are made to give you a deep understanding of the course material. Overall great professor!
He is a very nice prof. If you want a good mark, you have to study a lot, since this class covers a lot of accounting principles and calculations.

Kim is a very nice professor and for the most part, she can get across the necessary material. It can be a difficult course because she stumbles and can confuse herself while lecturing, doing all the questions and teaching yourself is the best way to learn along with the examples you do in class. Luckily if you show up to lectures you get 10%.

Excellent professor. He is technical but also encourages his students to think outside the box. He cares about his students and is very responsive to requests for help. Best accounting professor I have had.

He has good personality and is willing to help you. However, he did not prepare IFRS material and is VERY disorganized. Sometimes he teaches IFRS and yet sometimes it's GAAP..extremely confusing. Does not show effort in making complex material easier to understand. I did not learn much from his 321..might have to redo.. NOT RECOMMENDED for 321

One of the hardest accounting class in SFU. He tried his best to explain things and gave students good practices to prepare for the exams. His lecture notes are gems, included everything you need to know, However, there are so many things, so it is hard to remember all of them for the exams. He seems to be the best prof we have for BUS321 :)
He is one of the best accounting pofs I've ever had. He is a great marker and really helpful. He always responds to my emails quickly even after two years. He is amazing.
If there is a way to make accounting fun, Jamal knows how to do it.  His pace was sometimes very slow and sometimes a bit too fast but that is true for most courses anyway.

Best 321 professor hands down. Has great notes, basically a summary of the textbook. His exams are very fair- exactly what the HWQ and Notes are.   It's a difficult course, and he makes it manageable. I can't imagine taking this class with any other professor.
He is a great prof who can give a good understanding of fundamental principles in accounting. Really knowledgeable. Exams are pretty hard though and preparations require tons of effort.
Very good prof. Study his lecture well. Exam can be hard but the class is curved anyway. Going to class is a must to succeed. Reading textbook is unnecessary.
hard exam both midterm and final

Teresa is a great prof having taken 321 with her was one of my best experiences in an accounting course at Beedie. Make sure you do her practice questions and ask her for help and you'll be fine for her class.

Take any course with Teresa, and you'll enjoy it because she explains concepts in detail during her lectures and she is SO PATIENT with her explanations (she really cares about her students). Her quizzes, midterm and final exam are very fair. If you do the homework and truly understand the material, you will get an A.

Teresa's instructions were clear, and her grading was fair. The exams mirrored the homework for the most part. She was open and responsive to questions. BUS 321 content was quite dry, but Teresa made it easy to understand.
